Name.BusinessNameLine1: The ARC of Howard County Inc

IRS990.ActivityOrMissionDescription: Supporting full community life for children and adults with cognitive and developmental disabilities one person at a time.
IRS990.MissionDescription: To assure basic rights, societal integration, general welfare & maximum development of citizens who are developmentally disabled in howard county.
IRS990.Description: Residential - Individually designed supports to people with developmental disabilities so they can live in the neighborhood of their choice and be fully included in the life of the community.

Activity2.Description: Day and Employment - Employ. opportunities and supports to individuals and employers to ensure successful employment. A day program is offered to adults with severe disabilities who prefer a mix of vocational training & recreational activities

Activity3.Description: Community Supported living arrangements - provides support for people living more independently in the community

ActivityOther.Description: Family Support Services - Services provided to meet the needs of individuals with developmental disabilities living with their families.

Form990ScheduleDPartXIV.ReturnReference: Description of Intended Use of Endowment Funds:
Form990ScheduleDPartXIV.Explanation: THE SILVER ARC LEGACY FUND WAS CREATED WITH THE INTENT TO RAISE $1,000,000 TO SERVE THE CORPUS OF A PORTFOLIO THAT WILL USE ITS EARNINGS TO ENSURE THE ONGOING EXISTENCE OF THE ORGANIZATION. EARNINGS, LESS DIRECT COSTS, WILL BECOME A PART OF THE CORPUS UNTIL THIS THRESHOLD HAS BEEN ACHEIVED.

Form990ScheduleDPartXIV.ReturnReference: Description of Uncertain Tax Positions Under FIN 48:
Form990ScheduleDPartXIV.Explanation: The organization adopted the provisions of FASB ASC 740-10, previously known as FASB Interpretation No. 48, Accounting for Uncertainty in Income Taxes, on July 1, 2009. Management has determined that the Organization has no material uncertain tax positions that would require recognition under FASB ASC 740-10.

Form990ScheduleKPartI.DescriptionOfPurpose: renovations to the D.H.A and Helen C. Wright Building

GeneralExplanation.Identifier: Form 990, Part VI, Section A, line 6
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: The organization's members have the power to elect the members of the Board of Directors and retain the ability to alter or rescind actions of the board. All individual or family members in good standing have the right to vote and hold office.

GeneralExplanation.Identifier: Form 990, Part VI, Section A, line 7a
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: At the yearly annual meeting, members set the number of directors and elect officers and directors.

GeneralExplanation.Identifier: Form 990, Part VI, Section A, line 7b
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: Any action of the Board of Directors is subject to review by the voting membership on written request of 10 voting members. An action of the Board of Directors may be altered or rescinded by two-thirds of the votes cast, provided no rights of third parties are affected.

GeneralExplanation.Identifier: Form 990, Part VI, Section B, line 11
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: The finance committee will review the form in detail and then the Treasurer will go over it in summary at the board meeting. All committee members and directors will receive a copy, minutes will document the discussion

GeneralExplanation.Identifier: Form 990, Part VI, Section B, line 12c
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: The responsibilities are defined in the conflict of interest policy, but the President and Executive Director receive a summary for their mutual review annually.

GeneralExplanation.Identifier: Form 990, Part VI, Section B, line 15a
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: The Executive Director's salary was reviewed and compared to an outside salary comparison report that was compiled by MANO of area nonprofits, the review was done by the finance committee and reported to the president.

GeneralExplanation.Identifier: Form 990, Part VI, Section C, line 19
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: The governing documents, conflict of interest policy, and financial statements are made available to the public upon request.

The finance committee currently has a bid procees in place for the selection of the independent accountant and periodically evaluates the indpendent accountant. The process the committee uses for overseeing the audit of the financial statements and selection of the independent accountant has not changed from prior year.
